annotate.hits: here we want to display total hit count, so we need to bind to current velvet.vo.Search object in lynx.models.SearchModel
annotate.query: here we want to display search query, this information is available directly in velvet.vo.Search object
annotate.pageNo = 1: for navigating on pages we creating local variable
annotate.perPage = 100: we can set the page size
annotate.pageNo = pageNo - 1: for navigating results pages we simple changing the variable
annotate.pageNo = pageNo + 1: for navigating results pages we simple changing the variable

item.value: so the main part is displaying items in search results, we simple iterate over the items in the page in current search results, each item will be available in local scope

annotate.openDocumentById: for opening the document we have to call proper method on lynx.models.DocumentModel, model will be automatically retrieving all required data from Velvet
annotate.Summary: summary of search item can contains HTML, e.g. highlights, thats why we have to use html binding attribute instead of simple text node binding
